This Exhibit contains redacted material which has been separately filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The redaction is marked with [* * *]. While we have made every effort to ensure the accuracy of this unredacted version, we do not guarantee its completeness or authenticity, given the confidential nature of the redacted sections. ollama_generated:
Article 5 - Testing and Samples

  19.5.1 Testing at Own Risk (New)
    - The Supplier shall perform Release Testing on the Product at their own risk, understanding that any issues or failures may lead to additional costs or delays for them.

  19.5.2 Option for Additional Release Testing (Inverted)
    - The Customer has the option to request Additional Release Testing and will bear the associated costs, if deemed necessary by the Customer.

  19.5.3 Retention of Samples by Supplier (Shifting Responsibility)
    - The Supplier shall retain Retention Samples for a period as mutually agreed upon, ensuring their integrity and maintaining the required storage conditions.

  19.5.4 Stability Testing (No change)
    - The Supplier will conduct Stability Testing on the Product to ensure its long-term stability under various storage conditions.

  20.5.5 Reference Standards: Supplier Provision (Reversed condition)
    - The Supplier shall provide Reference Standards for the tests performed, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both parties.

  20.5.6 Preparation of Process Qualification (No change)
    - The Supplier will prepare documentation necessary for the Process Qualification as per the specified standards and guidelines.

   Article 6 - Purchase Orders

  20.6.1 Placement of Purchase Orders by Customer (Inverted)
    - The Customer shall place Purchase Orders, specifying the required quantity, delivery schedule, and other relevant details.

  20.6.2 Acceptance of Orders by Supplier (No change)
    - The Supplier will acknowledge receipt of the order and confirm its acceptance within a reasonable timeframe.

  21.6.3 Delays in Delivery (Weakened obligation)
    - In case of delays in delivery, the Supplier shall endeavor to minimize the impact on the Customer, keeping them informed of the status regularly.

  21.6.4 Cancellation of Purchase Orders (No change)
    - Either party may cancel a Purchase Order under specified circumstances, as outlined in this Agreement.

  21.6.5 Material Failure of Supply (No change)
    - In the event of Material Failure of Supply, the Supplier will promptly notify the Customer and work towards a mutually acceptable resolution.

  21.6.6 Services (No change)
    - The Supplier shall provide any agreed-upon services in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

   Article 7 - Shipment of Product

  22.7.1 Storage of Product at Supplier's Risk (Shifting Responsibility)
    - The Supplier will store the Product prior to its release and shipment, assuming all associated risks and costs.

  22.7.2 Release and Shipment of Product (No change)
    - The Supplier shall release and ship the Product according to the agreed-upon schedule and in compliance with relevant regulations.

  22.7.3 Documentation (No change)
    - The Supplier will provide all necessary documentation related to the Product's shipment.

  23.7.4 Steering Committee (No change)
    - The Steering Committee, as outlined in this Agreement, will oversee the shipping process and resolve any issues that may arise.

   Article 8 - Acceptance of Shipments

  23.8.1 Acceptance of Shipments by Customer (No change)
    - The Customer shall accept or reject the shipment within a reasonable timeframe upon its receipt, as per the specified procedures.

  24.8.2 Dispute of Rejected Product (No change)
    - In case the Customer rejects a shipment, they may initiate a dispute resolution process according to the terms outlined in this Agreement.

  24.8.3 Remedies for Disputed Shipments (Weakened obligation)
    - Upon successful resolution of disputes related to rejected shipments, the Supplier shall make every effort to provide a remedy that is mutually acceptable to both parties.

original: A. Customer is the owner of certain technology and patent rights regarding the Product (as defined herein) having the description set out in Exhibit A (Description of Product) and Exhibit B (Chemical Synthesis); B. Customer has filed / intends to file for approval with the United States Food and Drug Administration and/or its foreign equivalents, an Investigational New Drug Application (“IND”) and a New Drug Application (“NDA”), and/or the foreign equivalents thereof, for certain formulations containing the Product; C. Supplier is engaged in the business of performing contracted process development, Manufacturing and supply services of active pharmaceutical ingredients (“APIs”) and intermediates; and D. Customer desires that Supplier Manufacture the Product in bulk quantities, and Supplier desires to perform such services, each on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: A. The Supplier recognizes the ownership of certain technology, patent rights, and the associated intellectual property regarding the Product (as defined herein) as detailed in Exhibit A (Description of Product) and Exhibit B (Chemical Synthesis); B. The Supplier acknowledges that the Customer has filed or intends to file for approval with the United States Food and Drug Administration and/or its foreign counterparts, an Investigational New Drug Application (“IND”) and a New Drug Application (“NDA”), and/or their equivalent foreign versions, for specific formulations incorporating the Product; C. The Customer conducts business in the domain of research, development, and approval of pharmaceutical products, including but not limited to the filing and management of regulatory applications; D. In light of the above, the Supplier agrees to develop and manufacture the Product in bulk quantities upon the Customer's request, and the Customer is responsible for securing all necessary approvals and registrations, with the Supplier providing its services subject to these terms and conditions as outlined in this Agreement.

original: common control”) shall mean: (a) ownership of at least fifty percent (50%) of the equity capital or other ownership interest in or of an entity; (b) the power to control or otherwise direct the affairs of an entity; (c) in the case of non-stock organizations, the power to control the distribution of profits of an entity; or (d) such other relationship as, in fact, results in actual control over the management, business, and affairs of an entity; b) “Agreement” means this Supply Agreement for the Product, including all Exhibits attached hereto; c) “Applicable Law” means any applicable law, statute, rule, regulation, order, judgment or ordinance of any governmental or regulatory authority or agency; d) “Applicable Regulatory Authority” means FDA, EMEA and/or other equivalent governmental or regulatory authorities or agencies and any successors thereto; e) “Business Day” means any day on which banking institutions in Boston, Massachusetts and Bubendorf, Switzerland are open for business; f) “Campaign” means a schedule of one or more discrete batches of Product Manufactured in sequence by Supplier without pausing to change over to manufacture of any other product; g) “cGMP Requirements” means the current Good Manufacturing Practices standards required under ICH Q7A guideline and/or any similar standards of applicable governmental and/or regulatory authorities as defined in the Quality Agreement; h) “Change of Control” means any transaction or series of transactions wherein (a) the voting securities of Supplier outstanding immediately prior thereto cease to represent at least fifty percent (50%) of the combined voting power of the surviving entity immediately after such transaction or transactions; (b) the stockholders or equity holders of Supplier approve a plan of complete liquidation of Supplier, or an agreement for the sale or disposition by Supplier of all or substantially all of Supplier’s assets, other than to an Affiliate; (c) a Third Party becomes the beneficial owner of fifty percent (50%) or more of the combined voting power of the outstanding securities of Supplier; or (d) substantially all of Supplier’s business or assets which relate to this Agreement are sold or otherwise transferred to a Third Party; i) “Chemical Synthesis” means established and reliable execution of chemical reactions in order to produce the “Product” by applying chemical and physical manipulations usually involving one or more reactions; j) “Confidential Information” means all written information and data provided by the Parties to each other hereunder and identified as being “Confidential” and provided to the recipient, except that the term “Confidential Information” shall not apply to any information or any portion thereof which:
ollama_generated:
a) "Common Control" shall be defined as follows: (a) ownership of less than fifty percent (49%) of the equity capital or other ownership interest in or of an entity; (b) the power to be influenced by, rather than control or otherwise direct, the affairs of an entity; (c) in the case of non-stock organizations, the ability to receive a portion but not the majority of profits of an entity's business; or (d) any other relationship that could potentially influence the management, business, and affairs of an entity.
b) "Agreement" denotes this Supply Agreement for the Product, including all attached Exhibits.
c) "Applicable Law" encompasses any applicable law, statute, rule, regulation, order, judgment, or ordinance issued by any governmental or regulatory authority or agency.
d) "Applicable Regulatory Authority" refers to FDA, EMEA, and/or other equivalent governmental or regulatory authorities or agencies, as well as their successors.
e) "Business Day" is any day on which banking institutions in Boston, Massachusetts and Bubendorf, Switzerland are not closed for business.
f) "Campaign" constitutes a sequence of one or more batches of Product Manufacturing by the Supplier without interruption for the manufacture of any other product.
g) "cGMP Requirements" stands for the current Good Manufacturing Practices standards required under ICH Q7A guideline and/or similar standards defined in the Quality Agreement by any applicable governmental and/or regulatory authorities.
h) "Change of Control" involves any transaction or series of transactions where (a) the voting securities of Supplier, which represented at least fifty percent (50%) of the combined voting power immediately prior to such transaction(s), no longer represent this percentage in the surviving entity after such transaction(s); (b) the stockholders or equity holders of Supplier approve a plan for complete liquidation of Supplier, or an agreement for the sale or disposition by Supplier of all or substantially all of its assets, except to an Affiliate; (c) a Third Party acquires fifty percent (50%) or more of the combined voting power of the outstanding securities of Supplier; or (d) substantially all of Supplier's business or assets related to this Agreement are sold or otherwise transferred to a Third Party.
i) "Chemical Synthesis" is the established and reliable execution of chemical reactions, designed to produce the "Product," through the application of chemical and physical manipulations typically involving one or more reactions.
j) "Confidential Information" refers to all written information and data provided by either Party hereunder, marked as "Confidential," excluding any information or portion thereof which: (1) is or becomes publicly available without breach of this Agreement; (2) is received from a third party who lawfully possessed the information and had no obligation of confidentiality with respect to such information; (3) was independently developed by either Party without reference to or use of any Confidential Information received from the other Party; or (4) is required to be disclosed pursuant to applicable laws, regulations, or orders.

ollama_generated: (iii) ceases to be proprietary due to circumstances outside the scope of this Agreement, or (iv) the recipient can provide evidence through credible written documentation that the information was independently developed by or for the recipient or any of its Affiliates, by individuals or entities who were not previously privy to the information disclosed under this Agreement and had no access to it.

original: The Confidential Information may include, without limitation, data, know-how, formulae, processes, designs, sketches, photographs, plans, drawings, specifications, samples, reports, studies, data, findings, inventions, ideas, production facilities, machines, production capacities, prices, market share, research and development projects, and other market data. For the purposes of this Agreement, Master Batch Record shall be deemed the Confidential Information of Customer and the Product Specifications shall be deemed the Confidential Information of Customer; k) “Customer Licensee” means any Third Party to whom Customer grants a license or a right to research, develop, make, have made, use, sell, have sold, import, export or otherwise exploit a Product or Customer Product; l) “Customer Material” means the compound satisfying the Customer Material Specification; m) “Customer Material Specifications” means the specifications for the Customer Material set forth in the Quality Agreement, as such may be amended from time to time in accordance with its terms; n) “Customer Product” means any pharmaceutical product owned, controlled or sold by Customer, its Affiliates or Customer Licensees that incorporates or is derived from a Product; o) “Customer Technology” means:
ollama_generated:
The term "Confidential Information," as used in this Agreement, encompasses but is not limited to data, know-how, formulae, processes, designs, sketches, photographs, plans, drawings, specifications, samples, reports, studies, findings, inventions, ideas, production facilities, machines, production capacities, prices, market shares, research and development projects, and any other proprietary or commercially sensitive data. For the purposes of this Agreement, Master Batch Records shall be considered as Confidential Information exclusively owned by Customer, and Product Specifications will also be deemed to be Confidential Information belonging to Customer.

   k) "Customer Licensee" refers to any Third Party to whom Customer grants a license or right to research, develop, manufacture, use, distribute, commercialize, import, export, or otherwise utilize a Product or Customer Product.

   l) "Customer Material" denotes the compound that conforms to the Customer Material Specifications.

   m) "Customer Material Specifications" refers to the specifications for the Customer Material as outlined in the Quality Agreement, which may be modified at any time in accordance with its terms.

   n) "Customer Product" encompasses any pharmaceutical product owned, controlled, or marketed by Customer, its Affiliates, or Customer Licensees, that contains or is derived from a Product.

   o) "Customer Technology" includes:

     This revised clause aims to shift the responsibility of ownership for Master Batch Records and Product Specifications onto the Customer, and broaden the scope of the term "Customer Product" to include any product controlled or marketed by Customer Licensees that incorporates or is derived from a Product. Additionally, the definition of "Customer Technology" remains largely unchanged but is rephrased for clarity.

original: 3.6 Monitoring of Facilities Customer shall have the right to have a representative present at each Facility to observe the performance of the Manufacturing Process by Supplier during normal business hours with at least [* * *] advance notice. Supplier shall have the right to reasonably restrict such observation access to prevent undue interference with Supplier’s business operations or compromise Supplier’s confidentiality obligations to Third Parties; provided, however, Customer’s observation access shall be absolute with regard to the Manufacturing Process for the Product. As such it is Supplier’s obligation to segregate Third Party documents and materials from Customer’s documents and materials and Customer will not be restricted from observing any part of Customer’s Manufacturing Process and related documentation.
ollama_generated: 3.6 Observation Rights: Supplier grants Customer the right to observe the Manufacturing Process at each Facility during normal business hours, given a minimum of [* * *] notice. However, Supplier reserves the right to limit such observation access in instances where it deems that the observation could unduly interfere with its business operations or breach its confidentiality obligations to Third Parties. In these cases, Supplier will make reasonable efforts to accommodate Customer's requests while maintaining the necessary confidentiality. Notably, this right does not extend to observations of the Manufacturing Process related to products other than the one in question. Conversely, Customer is responsible for ensuring that their observations do not infringe upon Supplier's rights to keep Third Party documents and materials separate from those of Customer. This means that Customer may be restricted from certain areas or aspects of the Facility where such materials are present.

original: 3.12 Alternative Supply At any time during the Term, Customer may elect to qualify one or more alternative Manufacturing facilities (whether owned by a Third Party, Customer or by one of Customer’s Affiliates) to Manufacture the Products (each, a “Backup Supplier”). Customer shall be responsible for any costs associated with qualifying Backup Suppliers. [* * *]. Supplier shall use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with the qualification of any Backup Supplier, including (a) technology transfer of all Supplier Technology necessary or useful for the Manufacture of the Products; provided that, to the extent that such technology and know-how constitutes Confidential Information of Supplier, it shall be subject to the provisions of Article 12 and Customer’s designated alternative supplier shall be required to enter into a confidentiality agreement with Supplier containing substantially the same terms as Article 12 and (b) providing Customer and any Backup Supplier with consulting services related to the Manufacture, quality control and quality assurance of the Products. Any work related to technology transfer or qualification of a second supplier shall be considered as Services under this Agreement as described in Section 6.6. For the avoidance of doubt, Supplier will first prepare a customary Scope of Work describing the Services to be performed and the costs to Customer for the CONFIDENTIAL  Page 17 of 49 Source: PARATEK PHARMACEUTICALS, INC., 10-K/A, 5/5/2017 THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN REDACTED AND IS THE SUBJECT OF A CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUEST. REDACTED MATERIAL IS MARKED WITH [* * *] AND HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION.
ollama_generated:
3.12 Alternative Manufacturing Facilities
During the Term of this Agreement, Supplier shall allow Customer to designate one or more alternative manufacturing facilities (either owned by a Third Party, Customer, or an Affiliate) as secondary suppliers for the Production of Products (each, a "Backup Producer"). The Customer shall bear any costs associated with qualifying Backup Producers.

For cooperation in the qualification process, Supplier will make reasonable efforts available, including:
(a) transferring necessary or useful technology for the Production of Products, subject to the confidentiality provisions outlined in Article 12; the designated backup producer will be required to sign a non-disclosure agreement containing terms substantially similar to those in Article 12.
(b) providing consulting services regarding the Production, quality control, and quality assurance of the Products.

Any work related to technology transfer or qualification of an alternative supplier shall be considered as Services under this Agreement, as described in Section 6.6. In case of any ambiguity, Supplier will first draft a customary Scope of Work outlining the Services to be provided and the costs involved for the Customer.

In the event Supplier does not respond within [* * *], such Purchase Order shall be considered accepted by CONFIDENTIAL  Page 20 of 49 Source: PARATEK PHARMACEUTICALS, INC., 10-K/A, 5/5/2017 THIS EXHIBIT HAS BEEN REDACTED AND IS THE SUBJECT OF A CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUEST. modified:
6.2 Placement of Orders
Upon receiving a Purchase Order from Customer, Supplier reserves the right to decline any such order if it is not in alignment with this Agreement, providing written notice (e-mail serving as acceptable written notice) within a reasonable timeframe, not exceeding [* * *] following receipt of each Purchase Order, detailing the reasons for such rejection. In the event Supplier does not communicate a decision within [* * *], it shall be considered that the Supplier has accepted the Purchase Order implicitly and will proceed accordingly.

In this revised clause, we have inverted the condition: instead of an unanswered Purchase Order being automatically accepted, it is now considered accepted if no response is received within a certain timeframe, shifting the responsibility to the Supplier to explicitly reject the order if necessary.

Article 8 Inspection and Acceptance of Shipments

8.1 Duty to Inspect by Supplier or its Representatives
Within a period of [* * *] following the physical delivery of any Product shipment from Customer, Supplier or its authorized representatives shall conduct an inspection of the delivered goods for any discrepancies in quantity, quality, or conformity with specifications. Any detected shortages, defects, or deviations should be promptly communicated to the Customer.

This modification shifts the responsibility of inspection from the Customer to the Supplier, strengthening the Supplier's obligation to ensure that delivered products meet specified requirements.

original: Article 12 Confidentiality & Publicity 12.1 Obligation of Confidentiality It is contemplated that in the course of the performance of this Agreement each Party may, from time to time, disclose Confidential Information to the other. Each Party agrees:
ollama_generated:
Article 12 Confidentiality & Publicity

12.1 Scope of Confidentiality
It is understood that during the execution of this Agreement, either Party might find it necessary to share Confidential Information with the counterpart. Both Parties acknowledge and consent to the following:

- Upon disclosure, each Party shall maintain the confidentiality of the shared information and not disclose or use such information for any purpose other than fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement, unless explicitly authorized in writing by the disclosing Party.
- Each Party agrees to implement reasonable measures to protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized access, disclosure, or use, consistent with industry standards for safeguarding confidential business information.
- The obligations set forth herein shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement and apply indefinitely, unless otherwise agreed upon by both Parties in writing.

original: Upon the termination of this Agreement, each Party shall promptly destroy or return all Confidential Information to the disclosing Party in accordance with Section 18.4.
modified: Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, each Party retains the right to keep any and all Confidential Information in their possession, unless otherwise requested in writing by the disclosing Party within a reasonable timeframe following such event. The receiving Party shall however, cease from actively using, disseminating, or duplicating said Confidential Information beyond this point.

original: 12.2 Disclosure with Consent A Party receiving Confidential Information may, with the written consent of the disclosing Party, disclose such Confidential Information to entities or persons other than its corporate counsel, employees and contractors, on such terms and conditions as the disclosing Party may specify.
modified: 12.2 Permissible Sharing without Prior Approval: A Party holding Confidential Information is not required to seek prior written consent from the disclosing Party before sharing it with third parties, including but not limited to corporate counsel, employees, and contractors. However, if the Party chooses to share the Confidential Information with other entities or persons, they must comply with any specific terms and conditions imposed by the disclosing Party upon request.

original: (b) Supplier further covenants and agrees that, (i) with respect to any future Supplier Employee, Supplier or its Affiliate shall enter into a binding written arrangement with such Supplier Employee as set forth in Section 12.5(a) and (ii) with respect to any binding written arrangement referred to in this Section 12.5(b) or Section 12.5(a), Supplier shall enforce, to the fullest extent permitted under Applicable Law, the terms and provisions of such arrangement.
modified: (b) The Supplier undertakes and consents that, (i) for any future Employee of the Supplier, the Supplier or its Affiliate will refrain from entering into any future employment agreement unless it complies with the stipulations outlined in Section 12.5(a), and (ii) in relation to any pre-existing or future employment agreements as detailed in this Section 12.5(b) or Section 12.5(a), the Supplier shall not be obligated to enforce, beyond what is compulsory under Applicable Law, the terms and provisions of such agreements. This clause implies a non-enforcement discretion for the Supplier regarding these agreements, unless legally required to do so.

original: 13.3 No Other Warranty THE WARRANTIES SET OUT IN SECTIONS 13.1 AND 13.2 ARE THE SOLE WARRANTIES MADE BY EITHER PARTY TO THE OTHER AND TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, THE PARTIES HEREBY DISCLAIM ANY AND ALL OTHER WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OR GUARANTEES OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE PRODUCT OR ANY OTHER MATERIALS OR SERVICES TO BE SUPPLIED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
ollama_generated:
13.3 Expansive Warranty The extensive warranties detailed in Sections 13.1 and 13.2 constitute the full extent of the commitments made by either party to the other. To the maximum degree allowed by law, the parties mutually waive any and all other express or implied warranties, representations, or guarantees concerning the Product or any materials or services provided under this Agreement, including but not limited to any implied warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility to both parties by using the term "mutually waive" instead of "disclaim," and emphasizes the extent of the commitments made by either party by replacing "No other warranty" with "Extensive warranty." Additionally, the phrase "full extent" is used to indicate that this is the total commitment from both parties, while "maximum degree" suggests that they are waiving their rights to the maximum extent permitted by law.

original: 13.4 No Consequential Damages and Limitation of Liability a) [* * *], IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL OR INDIRECT DAMAGES, OR LOST PROFITS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY. THIS LIMITATION WILL APPLY EVEN IF THE OTHER PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.

This limitation applies even if a Party has been made aware of the possibility of such damage. However, in the event that a Party is found liable for any breach or default under this Agreement, its liability shall be limited to direct damages only, unless otherwise specified in writing by both Parties.

Article 14 Indemnification

14.1 Obligation of Indemnity
Supplier agrees to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Customer, as well as its officers, directors, agents, representatives, and employees, from any and all actions, claims, demands, proceedings, suits, losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorney fees) arising from or related to Third-Party Claims. These claims include those for personal injury or death, provided that such claims are not due to:

a) any product liability claim directly associated with Supplier's manufacturing, provision, or delivery of Products, or
b) the negligence or intentional misconduct of Supplier (excluding gross negligence), except in instances where Customer has a countervailing obligation to be indemnified by Supplier under Sections 14.2 or 14.3.

ollama_generated:
14.2 Indemnification of the Supplier shall be responsible for indemnifying, defending, and holding harmless the Customer, its Affiliates, and the Customer's Licensees, as well as their respective officers, directors, agents, employees, and consultants against any and all Claims (including Claims for personal injury or death), to the extent such claims result from or arise out of:

(a) any negligent acts or omissions or willful misconduct by the Customer or its representatives. This provision applies to any claims that may potentially impact the confidential information provided during this agreement, as marked with [* * *] in the original document and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission. original: Article 15 Insurance 15.1 Insurance Coverage Customer and Supplier each represent that they are sufficiently insured against any liability arising under this Agreement. Further, Supplier shall at a minimum retain [* * *].
ollama_generated:
Article 15 Insurance
15.1 Scope of Insurance Coverage: The parties acknowledge their insurance obligations, with the Customer and Supplier each certifying that they maintain appropriate insurance coverage for any potential liabilities arising from this Agreement. However, the minimum insurance requirements for the Supplier shall be discretionary, at their sole judgement, rather than being prescribed explicitly.

In this version, the obligation on the supplier to retain a specific level of insurance is shifted from an explicit requirement to a discretionary decision, making it less binding and potentially weaker.

original: 15.2 Evidence of Insurance Each of Customer and Supplier shall, upon request by the other, provide the other Party with a copy of all insurance policies maintained under this Article 15 relating to the Manufacture of the Product in bulk quantities and the facilities therefor and shall notify the other Party in writing at least 30 days prior to the cancellation of or any material change to such insurance policies. Each Party may request that the other Party procure and maintain such additional insurance coverage relating to the Manufacture of the Product and the facilities therefore as may be reasonably necessary in respect of the Parties’ respective obligations under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
15.2 Insurance Obligations
Both the Customer and Supplier are required, upon reasonable request by either Party, to supply copies of their insurance policies relevant to the Manufacture of the Product in bulk quantities and the associated facilities. This information should be updated at least 30 days prior to any policy cancellations or significant changes. It is important to note that neither Party is obligated to procure additional insurance coverage, but either may request such action from the other if they deem it necessary for fulfilling their respective obligations under this Agreement. However, the decision to obtain and maintain any additional coverage remains at the discretion of each Party.

original: 18.2 Consequences of Termination On expiration or the effective date of termination of this Agreement, if earlier:
modified:
18.2 Implications of Expiration or Termination: Upon the natural expiry or the chosen termination date of this Agreement, whichever occurs first:

This revision softens the language slightly by using "implications" instead of "consequences," and rephrases the order of events to emphasize the choice in termination.

original: Customer shall be entitled to assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, to any person without the consent of Supplier, provided that (i) such person acquires all, or substantially all, of Customer’s business or assets with respect to the Product, whether through merger or otherwise; (ii) such person is an Affiliate of Customer or a Customer Licensee; or (iii) Customer remains liable for any payments Supplier is or will be entitled to under this Agreement. Customer shall not assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, to any other person without the prior written consent of Supplier, not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.
ollama_generated:
Assigning this Agreement, either wholly or partially, lies within the discretion of the Assignee (potential new Customer), who may do so without seeking Supplier's consent, except in instances where:

(i) The Assignee does not acquire all or substantially all of Customer's business or assets related to the Product; or

(ii) The Assignee is neither an Affiliate of the Customer nor a Customer Licensee; or

(iii) The Customer does not remain liable for any payments Supplier may become entitled to under this Agreement.

However, in cases where the Assignee does not meet the criteria outlined above, their request for assignment requires the prior written approval of Supplier, which shall not be arbitrarily withheld, conditioned, or delayed.

original: 19.6 Performance Each Party agrees to perform its obligations under this Agreement, including under any Scope of Work, in a timely manner. Supplier shall allocate adequate resources to execute its obligations under this Agreement, including under each Scope of Work. Supplier represents and warrants that all Services shall be performed by qualified personnel in accordance with the highest industry standards.
ollama_generated:
19.6 Performance Each Party acknowledges its commitment to fulfilling their respective responsibilities as outlined within this Agreement, encompassing any attached Scope of Work. The Responsible Party assumes responsibility for ensuring appropriate resources are available to meet these obligations. While every effort will be made to adhere to industry standards and best practices, the Responsible Party does not guarantee the performance of Services by personnel possessing specialized qualifications.

Changes made:
- Weakened the obligation slightly by shifting the onus of allocating resources to the party responsible for fulfilling its obligations (Responsible Party).
- Changed the representation and warranty from a guarantee that services will be performed by qualified personnel to an acknowledgment that every effort will be made to adhere to industry standards, but qualifications are not guaranteed.

original: 19.10 Notices Unless otherwise provided herein, any notice required or permitted to be given hereunder or any proposal for any modification of this Agreement (hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Correspondence”) shall be faxed, mailed by overnight mail, certified mail postage prepaid, or delivered by hand to the Party to whom such Correspondence is required or permitted to be given hereunder at the addresses set out below. If delivered by hand, any such Correspondence shall be deemed to have been given when received by the Party to whom such Correspondence is given and if faxed, any such Correspondence shall be deemed to have been given on the first Business Day following facsimile transmission, as evidenced by written and dated receipt of the receiving Party.
ollama_generated:
19.10 Communications: Except as explicitly stated within this Agreement, all notices or proposals for modification (collectively referred to as "Communications") shall be delivered via email, courier, or in person to the designated addresses below. Emailed Communications will be considered as received on the day they are sent, while those delivered by courier or in person will be deemed delivered upon confirmation of receipt from the receiving party. No response is required to acknowledge receipt. If no reply is received within five (5) business days, the sender may resend the Communication or consider it as having been accepted unless otherwise explicitly communicated in writing.

This revised clause weakens the original by removing the requirement for a written and dated receipt of the receiving party when Communications are delivered by fax. It also relaxes the timeframe for responding to Communications, allowing more flexibility for the recipient. Additionally, it includes a provision for the sender to consider the Communication as accepted if no response is received within five business days unless otherwise communicated in writing, further weakening the obligation of the recipient to respond promptly.
